message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.DS

This paper proposes a method for reducing the memory and computational demands of training and inference in neural networks. The method involves selecting only a subset of highly salient channels to execute during each training step, using a combinatorial upper confidence bound algorithm. The paper validates the approach on state-of-the-art CNNs and image classification datasets. Given the focus on neural network training and image classification, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.CV (Computer Vision), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also involves optimization techniques, which could place it in the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category. Finally, the use of algorithms and data structures for efficient computation could also place it in the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) sub-category.
